page.title: 03Housing in the area.
page.content:
Housing in the Burnhervie area.
The majority of domestic buildings in the block are of traditional stone construction, usually of granite from one of several nearby quarries. Most buildings in the area date from the late eighteenth and nineteenth centuries. This was a time when local tenant farmers were prospering due to farming improvements and could afford to build new residences and cottages. These farmhouses are substantial dwellings of grey granite walls with grey slate roofs. A few new houses have been built near Burnhervie and some attempt has been made to make sure that these fit into the local environment. Almost all houses here are detached and are owner-occupied or rented privately.
